summary:
Pokemon sizes are so weird. Like Rattata for instance. It’s height is 
listed as 1′00″, hard to misinterpret, right? Well, does...
caption:
Pokemon sizes are so weird. Like Rattata for instance. It’s height is listed as 1′00″, hard to misinterpret, right? Well, does it mean it can fit into a 1 foot box or that it’s body is 1 foot long? Even perhaps it could mean that it’s head is 1 foot off the ground.  Because as you can see, all those are very different sizes, but all of them could be said to be 1′00″.

Equine Pokemon are even harder to size, I think. At least some of them. I know horse heights are measured at the withers, that is to say the front shoulder, however while this would work for a proportional horse like Ponyta or Rapidash, one like Keldo, who’s mostly neck, would be….ridiculously large to put it lightly.

That’s not even touching on things like wingspan for those that have wings.

But I swear I'm not all bad.

blog.name: pokebiologist
blog.title: Pokémon Biology
blog.description: I'm Theodora, but you can call me Thea! I'm a Battle Girl turned Pokémon Researcher, and I'm excited to share my observations with you. Feel free to ask, submit, request, and share your own findings!

summary: Any tips on looking after a Stunky and/or Skuntank?
question: Any tips on looking after a Stunky and/or Skuntank?
answer:
Well, I would definitely invest in high-quality house cleaners and shampoos (for yourself, the Stunky/Skuntank, and any other Pokémon you may have). Their bodies themselves don’t smell bad, but if they are startled as spray, that odor can linger for a very long time. Most Pokémon care shops in Sinnoh, and particularly those near areas where wild Stunky can be found, carry soaps specifically designed to get the stench out.

When it comes to care, they are very easy to feed, being opportunistic omnivores. They can share food with any feline Pokémon, and love treats of just about any kind. For bedding however, they need very specific attention. They are burrowers, and if they don’t get the sense that they have their own safe space, they tend to scent mark large areas, which is something that nobody wants to have happen to their house. They can be kept outside and supplied with branches and leaves, if you don’t care too much about the appearance of your yard, or a closet or small room can be given to them, filled with newspaper, old sheets, and other fun things to shred and build with.

-Thea

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

title: Taillow - 276
body:
Taillow is young-it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokemon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.

- Pokemon Alpha Sapphire

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Ferroseed and Ferrothorn
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Ferroseed and Ferrothorn
body:
597: Ferroseed

We’re just hitting off a bunch of first-time typings lately. This Grass/Steel type is interesting to say the least. It’s another Grass type that takes on the properties of a real-life seed, this is relatively immobile. But I feel that that gets emphasized for Ferroseed more than any other Pokemon in the same flavor as it. In its native generation, it’s relatively unanimated compared to other Pokemon. And now in a post-XY world, Ferroseed pretty much remains completely stationary. A trait I’ve for some reason found neat about it.

I think Ferroseed is basically meant to be one of those prickly seed pods that get stuck on animal fur (or if it’s your unlucky day, all over your pant legs) and are so difficult to get off you’d think it’s a wonder they hadn’t evolved to just grow straight on top of another animal. Actually shit. I think I just came up with a cooler idea for this thing’s Evolution that what we officially got.

Personal Score: 7.5/10

More fun a design than you’d think, just first looking at the thing.

598: Ferrothorn

But in all seriousness, Ferrothorn is a pretty cool and weird plant monster. Oddly enough, this family are cave-dwelling plants, apparently not needing sunlight to grow. Which is interesting, certainly. The clear weirdest detail about Ferrothorn are those tentacles hanging off the top of its head. It uses those to hang from the ceiling of a cave before falling down on top of unsuspecting prey. And it also clearly can use them to walk, as seen in the 3D sprite there.

Though now that I’ve just come up with that idea, I kinda wish that’s where it ended up. Growing on top of another Pokemon in one way or another. That’s too neat an idea to pass up and I’m actually gonna add it to my Pokemon wishlist now. Dang.

Personal Score: 8/10

Pretty cool!

Overall:

A neat pair, if nothing else!

body:
Guess who just finished up a prototype they’ve had on the cards for literal years? This nerd 👍🏻👍🏻

I’ll be releasing them in my store sometime in the future, once I have a few more designs. If anyone has any pokemon requests let me know so I can see what’s popular.

(My store is, as always, polkadotnerd.etsy.com )
